questions.question: The Yellowstone River is the longest undammed river in the lower 48 states. Its length, in miles, is:
The three tributaries of the Missouri River begin within, or just west of the Park.  Which of these rivers do not go on to form the Missouri:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is 4,000 feet wide and 1,200 feet deep in places.  It is thought that the canyon was initially formed by:
Which bird species builds their impressively large stick nests near the Yellowstone river?
questions.info: Osprey nests are often about five feet in diameter. Osprey almost exclusively eat live fish and at maximum, can dive about 3 feet into the water, so they favor shallow fishing grounds.
